game.engine.image

Class NinePatchImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.engine.image.NinePatchImage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Image

    public class NinePatchImage
extends java.lang.Object
implements Image
    This class represents a nine pitch image. Such an image contains a 1px border. Black pixel(Color.BLACK ) at the left or top border indicate the stretch regions. Relative size of multiple regions will be kept.
    Author:
    Marvin Bruns

      • NinePatchImage

        public NinePatchImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage src)
        Crates a new stretchable image from a nine patch image. The data array is shared (consider creating a copy of the image).
        Parameters:
        src - The shared source image
        See Also:

      • getNaturalSize

        public Size getNaturalSize()
        Get the natural minimum size of this image. Natural means the pixel of the image, that aren't marked as stretch area.
        Returns:
        The natural minimum size

      • getInsets

        public java.awt.Insets getInsets()
        Get the Insets specified by the underlying nine patch source image.
        Returns:
        The Insets specified by the nine patch source image

      • getSourceSize

        public Size getSourceSize()
        Get the source size of this image. The source size is the size the underlying image provides without the patch indicator border. This results in the a size of:

        src.getWidth() - 2, src.getHeight() - 2

        As the insets are returned as absolute values calculated with the source size you can calculate the relative insets with the source size.
        Returns:
        The source size of this image

      • getSize

        public Size getSize()
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Get the original size of the image
        Specified by:
        getSize in interface Image
        Returns:
        The original size of the image
        See Also:

      • getQuality

        public int getQuality()
        Get the used interpolation quality.
        Returns:
        The used interpolation quality

      • setQuality

        public void setQuality(int quality)
        Set the interpolation quality values from 0 to 2 are allowed. Values out of the range will be increased/decreased to fit the range.
        Parameters:
        quality - Interpolation quality
